alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 6:29AM AKST until January 29 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility and very cold wind chills expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible through Monday. North winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Very cold wind chills to 50 below. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow, blowing snow, gusty north winds and cold wind chills will continue into Monday morning. Snow is expected pick up tonight and continue into Monday. This will cause cause low visibility in blowing snow and heavy drifting snow through Monday morning. North winds and blowing snow are expected to decrease Monday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range South of Trims Camp
